DOC.brief_summary: To assess effectiveness protocol ovarian hyperstimulation combine urinary gonadotrophin + GnRH antagonist v urinary gonadotrophin , achieve clinical pregnancy female undergo intrauterine insemination . Study hypothesis : protocol combine urinary gonadotrophin + GnRH antagonist effective monotherapy .
DOC.brief_title: Comparative Assessment Clinical Utility Ovarian Stimulation With Menotropin Versus Menotropin Plus GnRH Antagonist
DOC.criteria: Women age 1836 year Body mass index ( BMI ) 18 26 Prolactin within laboratory normal range Couples affect sterility able treat IUI ( intrauterine insemination ) Patients undergoing MenopurÂ® treatment Normal thyroid function Regular menses ( 2135 day ) Couples willing participate study sign informed consent form Seminal sample REM > 3 million Two previous ART ( assist reproductive technology ) cycle without ongoing pregnancy Policystic ovarian syndrome Evidence significant bacterial infection seminogram couple precede 6 month
